item.title: A Game of Thrones (A Song of Ice and Fire, Book 1) by George R.R. Martin
item.description: George RR Martin’s Song of Ice and Fire series receives almost universal acclaim from reviewers. I picked up A Game of Thrones after seeing it recommended by several reviewers. Since it is billed as the entry into an epic fantasy series, I half-expected to see a fantastic world populated by magic wielders and magical creations. Instead, I found that magic is virtually non-existent. Gritty, harsh realism is the predominant theme in Martin’s medieval universe.
